name: HD 219077
scenarioDescription:
The HD 219077 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 219077 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.91 times its radius. It is located 95.27 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 219077 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 219077 system


HD 219077 b

HD 219077 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 6.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 219077 b is 3304.02 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 219077 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 219077, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
